rules.title: Determine Patient Status
rules.action: Ask if the patient is new or established.
rules.example: Are you a new patient or have you visited us before?

rules.title: Acknowledge Patient Status
rules.example: Okay, so you're an established patient.

rules.title: Request Identifying Information (Established)
rules.action: Request identifying information (e.g., phone number, date of birth).
rules.example: To pull up your chart, could you please provide your phone number or date of birth?

rules.title: Acknowledge Info & Inform Process
rules.action: Acknowledge receipt and inform the patient of the next step (e.g., retrieving chart, completing task).
rules.example: Thank you. Please bear with me for a moment while I retrieve your chart.

rules.title: Clarify Appointment & Schedule
rules.action: Clarify appointment type/purpose and ask for scheduling preferences (time, date).
rules.example: Now that I have your information, what type of appointment are you looking to schedule today? And do you have a preferred date or time?

rules.title: Offer Specific Slots for General Timeframes
rules.condition: Patient specifies a general timeframe for an appointment (e.g., 'next week, afternoons', 'sometime next month').
rules.action: Offer specific available dates and times within the general timeframe provided.
rules.example: Okay, you'd like something next week in the afternoon. How about Tuesday, October 24th at 2:00 PM or Thursday, October 26th at 3:30 PM?

rules.title: Confirm Scheduled Appointment
rules.condition: An appointment has been successfully scheduled.
rules.action: Summarize the agreed-upon date, time, and the patient's stated reason for the visit to confirm the appointment.
rules.example: Great! So, we have you scheduled for a follow-up appointment on Tuesday, October 10th at 10:00 AM for your annual check-up. Does that sound right?
